attributes.action: Clamp down on fake forces charities and charity scams
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of these so called charities eventually get investigated by the charities commission, closed down only to re open as a different name. Most of the charities are named in such a way that they can imply a loose association with genuine charities or forces organisations. (Army, Heroes, Angels, Invicta, Knights etc)
The rules that define a charity need to be tightened up so that loop holes are closed and more of the funds raised need to be ring-fenced for proper charitable use.
attributes.background: There are many charities being set up and run, using the Armed forces as a means of gaining donations from the public. Most of these charities donate a tiny proportion and the remainder is used for "expenses". These charities are used as means or gaining money not for charity

rejection.details:
If you would like to complain about the conduct of a specific organisation, you can find out how to do that here:

https://www.gov.uk/complain-about-charity

If you would like the Government or Parliament to take some action - for example, by changing the laws or regulations that apply to charities - you could start a petition calling for the specific change that you would like to see.
